body:
https://github.com/Tox/Tox-Client-Standard/blob/master/user_identification/avatar.md

The maximum size of the encoded avatar data is 65536 bytes (64KiB).

comment_data.body: Why is this labelled as a security issue? The length of the file is still given by toxcore, so clients shouldn't be using a 64 KiB fixed buffer and be vulnerable to a buffer overflow.

@anthonybilinski if avatar FTs are autoaccept in clients, and someone sends you 1TByte avatar file, there could be nasty effects.

let's change the label, can you suggest a better label?

Ah that's true. I think generally Tox Client Standard isn't really toxcore's responsibility, and clients that want to follow TCS could limit the size to 64 KiB themselves and reject the transfer otherwise. I'm not sure about the label, maybe CAT:suggestion?

>Avatars must be PNG images.

I don't agree with this. .png images are much larger in size than .jpg images. Forcing using .png images in clients when avatar limit is 64 KiB is a bit strange. Many forums have such dumb restrictions and it's annoying.

and why 64 KiB when Tox is capable of transferring large files at large speed?

>I don't think this should be toxcore's responsibility
I don't think this should be toxcore's responsibility. I'd be happy to support a higher level API on top of toxcore that takes care of this type of thing.
@Monsterovich well lets see after someone sends you a 1TByte avatar file to your client

I don't see what the problem is. `file_size` tells the size of the avatar being transferred. If it's too large, a client should cancel the transfer. Also, you are quoting Tox Client Standard, those limits don't apply to toxcore.

>well lets see after someone sends you a 1TByte avatar file to your client

I meant why make 64 Kb limit and not 1 Mb. We are not in 2004.
some sensible value (64k was the TCS proposal)

> I meant why make 64 Kb limit and not 1 Mb. We are not in 2004.

What size (in pixels) of avatar is meant?
Avatar often is picture about 150px*150px (maybe less). 1MB - is very large file for this size.

>Avatar often is picture about 150px*150px (maybe less). 1MB - is very large file for this size.

Sure but users don't like editing images to fit the limits. 1MB will be enough for all cases.

If the concern is causing users to have to edit their own avatars, the client could implement automatic downscaling similar to this: https://github.com/qTox/qTox/blob/f6daafe914eba45fc66f06900cd88d001677f3bf/src/model/profile/profileinfo.cpp#L359
 
Though I'd still be in favour of increasing the TCS max size. But I think this issue is just getting further off topic.
Toxcore doesn't and shouldn't care about file transfer limits. This is the client's responsibility. File types are just a number clients can use arbitrarily.

title: limit avatar byte size in toxcore (65536 bytes), return error code if its over the size limit
